author: trawick
msg: PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT is for initialization, not arbitrary assignment

author: jerenkrantz
msg: I think we could do some things to work around it, but now that the problem
is definitely autoconf's, I don't feel like hacking around something that
is their problem and that they could fix in ~2 lines.

author: rbb
msg: Add an apr_thread_once function to allow a program to make sure that
a function is only called once.

author: bjh
msg: Drop hint that gethostby*() functions are thread safe on OS/2.

author: wrowe
msg: Toggle the /Zi flag to allow all supportd versions of VC (5, 6, 7) to
build 'out of the box' in debugging mode.
